intro: Hibbertia cuneiformis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its slender, ribbed stems and distinctive, narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers with five petals, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal regions. Hibbertia cuneiformis is well adapted to arid conditions and is an important component of its native ecosystems.
